result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea Rachel Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same for extended supervision.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
Cash bond on file to be applied.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.  
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain a stable residence.

Defendant shall have no contact with AMP.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances and or paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrea Rachel Martinez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Assignment of Judge; attempted not known

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea Rachel Martinez in court and by Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Cases called:  21CF344 and 22CF17 (Branch 1 case).  Upon a plea to Ct. 1 of 22CF17, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2 along with 21CF344.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 and 21CF344 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea Rachel Martinez in court and by Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Cases called:  21CF344 and 22CF17.  Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.
Notice of hearing for 5/4/22; attempted not known

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea Rachel Martinez not in court.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Andrea Rachel Martinez. Case called at 11:20 a.m.  (22JV15A Br. 2; 21CF344 Br. 3)  Atty. Weil states the cases were tied together in Branch 4 with a TAD program but did not proceed that way in Br. 4 and this case returned to Br. 1 and counsel neglected to contact the defendant and made contact with the defendant this a.m. and she was not aware of today's hearing and is not defendant's fault for not being present and request adjournment.  Counsel states there has been an additional pretrial with a non-TAD offer and anticipate resolution with Br. 3 case 21CF344.
Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea Rachel Martinez in court and by Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Cases called: 
 21CF344 & 22CF17.   Pretrial held.  Per counsel, an alternative offer is being considered as the previous offer of a deferred prosecution agreement is no longer available.  Court sets Branch 3 case two day jury trial.  22CF17 to return to Branch I.

Prosecuting Attorney Alyssa M. Schaller appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea Rachel Martinez appears in court and by Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Cases called:  21CF344 and 22CF17 (Branch 1) Explanation by defendant as to nonappearance.  Court reinstates bond.  Case may resolve with TAD Program.  Adjourned to allow further pretrial.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil appeared in court for Andrea Rachel Martinez.  Cases called:  21CF344 and 22CF17 (Branch 1 case)  Per Atty. Weil, defendant was not able to appear today due to a family emergency.  Resolution anticipated.  Warrant and bail forfeiture stayed until adjourned date.  Arraignment scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Per request of Atty. Weil, 22CF17 scheduled for arraignment/anticipated global resolution with Branch 3 case 21CF344 on March 2, 2022 at 1:15 p.m.

Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andrea Rachel Martinez appeared in court, Attorney Matthew Edward Weil appeared in court for Andrea Rachel Martinez. Clerk: EZ.  (21CF344 Br. 3)  Atty. Weil states defendant is being referred to TAD program and has assessment tomorrow.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Atty. Weil is hopeful for global resolution in Branch 3.
Arraignment scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/consume any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andrea Rachel Martinez appeared by zoom video, in custody at WC Jail, Attorney Matthew Edward Weil appeared b zoom video for Andrea Rachel Martinez. Clerk: EZ. (21CF344 Br. 3) Dennis D. appears on defendant's behalf.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests $500.00 cash bond.  Atty. Weil states the father of her children has been trying to find treatment for the defendant and has been in contact with a provider at Lakeshore and defendant could begin outpatient treatment on 1-19-2022 and requests lower cash bond or a signature bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond reluctantly and admonishes the defendant on bond conditions.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
